messages.message:
...and new crafting env is stuck on building (possible just UI) and fails to create a new org with this error:
https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/demetr-sand11?cw=dev
```2025/07/28 17:44:24 ERROR coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:223 -- [INTERNAL]: Invalid organization name
2025/07/28 17:44:24 ERROR coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:223 -- [INTERNAL]: Invalid organization name
...
2025/07/28 17:44:47 ERROR coreplatformservice/account/handler/org.go:420 -- Fail: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids
2025/07/28 17:44:47 ERROR coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:223 -- [INTERNAL]: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids
2025/07/28 17:44:47 ERROR coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:223 -- [INTERNAL]: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids```
Do I have to run anything specific after creating a crafting env?
No, it's supposed to be automatic

Your configuration files are incorrect:

```
cat owner@dev:~$ cat ~/.aws/config
[default]
region = us-east-1
[profile aws-dev-bedrock-549230430157]
sso_start_url = https://d-9067ba412e.awsapps.com/start/#
sso_region = us-east-1
sso_account_id = 549230430157
sso_role_name = aws-dev-bedrock
region = us-east-1
sso_session = crafting
[sso-session crafting]
sso_start_url = https://d-9067ba412e.awsapps.com/start/#
sso_region = us-east-1
sso_registration_scopes = sso:account:access
owner@dev:~$ cat ~/.docker/config.json
{
  "credHelpers": {
     "gcr.io (http://gcr.io)": "gcloud",
     "549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com)": "ecr-login"
  }
}```
I will correct them for you now
There may be a 2nd issue with your AWS roles -- I messaged you directly @demetr.starshov
